df-lmod
blocks.content: Define the class of all left modules, which are generalizations of left vector spaces. A left module over a ring is an (Abelian) group (vectors) together with a ring (scalars) and a left scalar product connecting them. (Contributed by NM, 4-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: df-scaf
blocks.content: Define the functionalization of the ` .s ` operator. This restricts the value of ` .s ` to the stated domain, which is necessary when working with restricted structures, whose operations may be defined on a larger set than the true base. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: islmodd
blocks.content: Properties that determine a left module. See note in ~ isgrpd2 regarding the ` ph ` on hypotheses that name structure components. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm islmodd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(cplusg, c0)))

  -| wi(w0, wceq(c6, cfv(cplusg, c3)))

  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c5), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s2), c1))), wceq(co(cv(s0), c4, co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2))), co(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c2, co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s2)))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c5), wcel(cv(s1), c5), wcel(cv(s2), c1))), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), c6, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s2)), co(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s2)), c2, co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s2)))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c5), wcel(cv(s1), c5), wcel(cv(s2), c1))), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s2)), co(cv(s0), c4, co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s2)))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wceq(co(c8, c4, cv(s0)), cv(s0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)

  -| diffsc(s0, c8)

  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)

  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  syl3anbrc(w0, wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cfv(csca, c0), crg), wral(s0, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), wral(hs2, cfv(cbs, c0), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c0), wa(w3a(wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), cfv(cbs, c0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(hs2))), co(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), cfv(cplusg, c0), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs2)))), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cfv(cplusg, cfv(csca, c0)), cv(hs0)), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), co(co(cv(s0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), cfv(cplusg, c0), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1))))), wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, cfv(csca, c0)), cv(hs0)), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), co(cv(s0), cfv(cvsca, c0), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)))), wceq(co(cfv(cur, cfv(csca, c0)), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs1)))))))))

  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(c4, cfv(cur, c7)), c8), wcel(c7, cgrp), wcel(cfv(cur, c7), c8))
  syl(w0, wcel(c7, cgrp), wcel(c7, crg))

blocks.name: lmodabl
blocks.content: A left module is an abelian group (of vectors, under addition). (Contributed by NM, 8-Dec-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm lmodabl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
} = {
  isabld(hs0, hs1, c0, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), wcel(c0, clmod))
  eqidd(cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, clmod))
  eqidd(cfv(cplusg, c0), wcel(c0, clmod))
  lmodgrp(c0)
  lmodcom(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0), cv(hs1), cfv(cplusg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, clmod))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, clmod))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lmodabl(class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà LMod ‚Üí c0 ‚àà Abel)
} = {
  isabld(hs0, hs1, c0, (Base ` c0), (+ ` c0), c0 ‚àà LMod)
  eqidd((Base ` c0), c0 ‚àà LMod)
  eqidd((+ ` c0), c0 ‚àà LMod)
  lmodgrp(c0)
  lmodcom(c0, hs0, (Base ` c0), hs1, (+ ` c0))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  eqid((+ ` c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((Base ` c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c((Base ` c0))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚àà LMod)
  diff.hs1.w(c0 ‚àà LMod)
}

blocks.name: lmodnegadd
blocks.content: Distribute negation through addition of scalar products. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lmodnegadd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, co(co(c1, c2, c3), c4, co(c5, c2, c6))), co(co(cfv(c7, c1), c2, c3), c4, co(cfv(c7, c5), c2, c6))))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cbs, c9))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplusg, c9))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvsca, c9))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cminusg, c9))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(csca, c9))
  -| wceq(c11, cfv(cbs, c10))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cminusg, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c11))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c11))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c8))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c0, co(co(c1, c2, c3), c4, co(c5, c2, c6))), co(co(cfv(c7, c1), c2, c3), c4, co(cfv(c7, c5), c2, c6)), co(cfv(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), c4, cfv(c0, co(c5, c2, c6))), w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, co(co(c1, c2, c3), c4, co(c5, c2, c6))), co(cfv(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), c4, cfv(c0, co(c5, c2, c6)))), wcel(c9, cabl), wcel(co(c1, c2, c3), c8), wcel(co(c5, c2, c6), c8))
  syl(w0, wcel(c9, cabl), wcel(c9, clmod))
  lmodabl(c9)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(co(c1, c2, c3), c8), wcel(c9, clmod), wcel(c1, c11), wcel(c3, c8))
  lmodvscl(c9, c1, c11, c3, c8, c2, c10)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(co(c5, c2, c6), c8), wcel(c9, clmod), wcel(c5, c11), wcel(c6, c8))
  lmodvscl(c9, c5, c11, c6, c8, c2, c10)
  ablinvadd(c9, co(c1, c2, c3), c8, co(c5, c2, c6), c0, c4)
  oveq12d(cfv(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), c4, cfv(c0, co(c5, c2, c6)), co(cfv(c7, c1), c2, c3), co(cfv(c7, c5), c2, c6), w0)
  lmodvsneg(c0, c1, c2, c3, c7, c8, c9, c10, c11, w0)
  lmodvsneg(c0, c5, c2, c6, c7, c8, c9, c10, c11, w0)
}

thm lmodnegadd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 `((c1[c2]c3)[c4](c5[c2]c6)))=(((c7 ` c1)[c2]c3)[c4]((c7 ` c5)[c2]c6)))
  ‚ä£ c8 =(Base ` c9)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(+ ` c9)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(√ó ` c9)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(invg ` c9)
  ‚ä£ c10 =(Scalar ` c9)
  ‚ä£ c11 =(Base ` c10)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(invg ` c10)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c9 ‚àà LMod)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c11)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà c11)

blocks.name: lmodprop2d
blocks.content: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is a left module iff the other one is. This version of ~ lmodpropd also breaks up the components of the scalar ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: lmodpropd
blocks.content: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is a left module iff the other one is. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lmodpropd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, clmod)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wceq(co(cv(s0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(s1))))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c3, cfv(csca, c1)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c2))), wceq(co(cv(s0), cfv(cvsca, c0), cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), cfv(cvsca, c1), cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  lmodprop2d(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cfv(csca, c0), cfv(csca, c1), c4, w0)
  eqid(cfv(csca, c0))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c1))
  syl5eq(c4, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c0)), cfv(cbs, c3), w0)
  fveq2d(cbs, c3, cfv(csca, c0), w0)
  syl5eq(c4, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c1)), cfv(cbs, c3), w0)
  fveq2d(cbs, c3, cfv(csca, c1), w0)
  oveqd(cv(s0), cfv(cplusg, cfv(csca, c0)), cv(s1), cfv(cplusg, cfv(csca, c1)), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4))))
  fveq2d(cplusg, cfv(csca, c0), cfv(csca, c1), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4))))
  oveqd(cv(s0), cfv(cmulr, cfv(csca, c0)), cv(s1), cfv(cmulr, cfv(csca, c1)), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4))))
  fveq2d(cmulr, cfv(csca, c0), cfv(csca, c1), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4)), wceq(cfv(csca, c0), cfv(csca, c1)))
  eqtr3d(cfv(csca, c0), cfv(csca, c1), c3, w0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csca, c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csca, c1)
  diff.csca.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, csca, c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, csca, c1)
  diff.csca.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lmodpropd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà LMod ‚Üî c1 ‚àà LMod))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 =(Base ` c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 =(Base ` c1))
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2))‚Üí(s0[(+ ` c0)]s1)=(s0[(+ ` c1)]s1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 =(Scalar ` c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 =(Scalar ` c1))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2))‚Üí(s0[(√ó ` c0)]s1)=(s0[(√ó ` c1)]s1))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  lmodprop2d(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, (Scalar ` c0), (Scalar ` c1), c4, w0)
  eqid((Scalar ` c0))
  eqid((Scalar ` c1))
  syl5eq(c4, (Base `(Scalar ` c0)), (Base ` c3), w0)
  fveq2d(cbs, c3, (Scalar ` c0), w0)
  syl5eq(c4, (Base `(Scalar ` c1)), (Base ` c3), w0)
  fveq2d(cbs, c3, (Scalar ` c1), w0)
  oveqd(s0, (+ `(Scalar ` c0)), s1, (+ `(Scalar ` c1)), (w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c4)))
  fveq2d(cplusg, (Scalar ` c0), (Scalar ` c1), (w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c4)))
  oveqd(s0, (√ó `(Scalar ` c0)), s1, (√ó `(Scalar ` c1)), (w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c4)))
  fveq2d(cmulr, (Scalar ` c0), (Scalar ` c1), (w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c4)))
  adantr(w0, (s0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c4), (Scalar ` c0)=(Scalar ` c1))
  eqtr3d((Scalar ` c0), (Scalar ` c1), c3, w0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csca, c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csca, c1)
  diff.csca.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, csca, c0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, csca, c1)
  diff.csca.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: gsumvsmul
blocks.content: Pull a scalar multiplication out of a sum of vectors. This theorem properly generalizes ~ gsummulc2 , since every ring is a left module over itself. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 6-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 10-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm gsumvsmul(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, co(c2, c3, c4))), co(c2, c3, co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c4)))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(csca, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cplusg, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvsca, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c1, c4), cfsupp, c8))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {

blocks.name: mptscmfsuppd
blocks.content: A function mapping to a scalar product in which one factor is finitely supported is finitely supported. Formerly part of proof for ~ ply1coe . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 8-Aug-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Oct-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mptscmfsuppd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2, c3)), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c4)))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(csca, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvsca, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, clmod))

  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c0, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c6)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

} = {

  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2, c3)), cfsupp, cfv(c0g, c4))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  mptscmfsupp0(s0, c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2, c3, cfv(c0g, c4), c7, c4, c6, c5, universe, cfv(c0g, c6), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(c6, cfv(csca, c4)))
  fvexd(c1, cv(s0), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))

blocks.name: rmodislmod
blocks.content: The right module ` R ` induces a left module ` L ` by replacing the scalar multiplication with a reversed multiplication if the scalar ring is commutative. The hypothesis "rmodislmod.r" is a definition of a right module analogous to the definition ~ df-lmod of a left module, see also ~ islmod . (Contributed by AV, 3-Dec-2021.)
